title: Shots fired at house in Midigama
byline: A shooting incident reported at Pathegama in Midigama this morning, according to the police.

title: Will Govt opt for private sector partnership for SriLankan Airlines?
byline: Partnership with the private sector is among the multiple options for the development of the state-run SriLankan Airlines but the government has not decided on any since its focus is now on the national carrier’s debt restructuring, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Six CID teams still pursue Deshabandu Tennakoon
byline: Six teams from the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) are still conducting their investigations to arrest the suspended Inspector General of Police, Deshbandu Tennakoon, who is evading arrest following a court order.

title: Sri Lanka’s industrial sector rebounds as economic conditions improve
byline: Sri Lanka is regaining its industrial strength, which weakened during and after the economic crisis in 2022, as reflected in the index that tracks industrial activity.

title: Sri Lanka’s tourism income hits US$768 mn in first two months of 2025
byline: Earnings from Sri Lanka’s tourism trade has continued to remain robust during the height of the seasonal peak as arrivals have been stronger. This is while the country is being recognised and featured by global publications as one of the most preferred destinations for travel in 2025.

title: Suspect arrested for sexual assault of flight attendants
byline: A 38-year-old man from Athurugiriya has been arrested on charges of sexually assaulting two flight attendants aboard a flight returning to Sri Lanka from Singapore.

title: Trump moves to close down Voice of America
byline: US President Donald Trump has signed an order to strip back federally funded news organisation Voice of America, accusing it of being ’’anti-Trump’’ and ’’radical’’.

title: Vatican releases first photo of Pope Francis in hospital
byline: Pope Francis was photographed at the hospital for the first time since he was admitted last month for double pneumonia.

title: 21 injured as bus crashes into house in Arachchikattuwa
byline: At least 21 individuals were injured when a passenger bus belonging to the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) collided with a shop and a house in the Baththuluoya area of Arachchikattuwa this morning.

title: Sri Lanka needs Truth and Forgiving Commission: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka needs a Truth and Forgiving Commission while it has to be turned into a rainbow nation, Minister of Religeous Affairs and Buddha Sasana Sunil Senavi told Parliament today.

title: FitsAir to launch direct flights to Kuala Lumpur from April
byline: FitsAir, Sri Lanka’s first privately owned international airline will launch direct flights to Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, from 4 April, as part of its regional expansion strategy, the airline said in an announcement.

title: Foreign preachers sans proper documents removed from Sri Lanka
byline: Amidst a strict ruling by the Department of Immigration and Emigration (DIE) regarding foreign preachers entering Sri Lanka for prayer festivals sans relevant religious visas is in place, the authorities raided another congregation in Nuwara Eliya during the weekend and ordered two foreign pastors to leave the country with immediate effect, the Dailymirror learns.

title: ’’Catch me if you can’’
byline: Six teams from the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) are still conducting their investigations to arrest the suspended Inspector General of Police, Deshbandu Tennakoon, who is evading arrest following a court order.

title: More witnesses ready to testify on Batalanda incident: Tilvin
byline: Claiming that there are more witnesses to testify on the Batalanda incident, JVP General Secretary Tilvin Silva said today if the evidence is produced, not only former President Ranil Wickremesinghe but others who were involved in the incident will have to face legal consequences.

title: Not possible to mete out justice on behalf of Easter attack victims in a month or two: Minister
byline: It is not possible to mete out justice for those who were affected by the Easter Sunday attacks within a month or two, Minister of Science and Technology Chrishantha Abeysena told Parliament yesterday.

title: Batalanda Commission faults JVP for acts of terrorism
byline: The commission which looked into what is called the torture chamber in Batalanda way back in 1989 has faulted Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) in addition to the then government, for engaging in severe acts of violence, during the given period.

title: Govt will introduce new Constitution according to its own time: Minister
byline: The Government will introduce the new Constitution according to its own time line, Minister of Justice Harshana Nanayakkara told Parliament today.

title: Prison Jailer remanded till March 21 for aiding and abetting in Ganemulla Sanjeewa murder
byline: A prison jailer, who was arrested by the Colombo Crimes Division over allegations of aiding and abetting the murder of Ganemulla Sanjeewa, was remanded till March 21 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Harshana Kekunawela today.

title: Another tusker found dead
byline: The carcass of a tusker was recovered today from the Ihakuluwewa tank reservation in Polonnaruwa by the Diyabeduma Police.

title: Customs bust Rs.24 Mn worth ‘Kush’ smuggling attempt at BIA
byline: Sri Lanka Customs today thwarted an attempt to smuggle two kilos of Cannabis variety ‘Kush’ worth over Rs. 24 million by an Indian couple returning from Bangkok at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA).

title: Some 400 vehicles stuck at Customs due to import rule change: VIAL
byline: The Vehicle Importers Association of Lanka (VIAL) claimed today that around 400 vehicles have been stuck at the Sri Lanka Customs for over 20 days due to a change in import regulations.

title: Steps must be taken to eliminate child labour from country
byline: The representatives of the National Steering Committee on Elimination of Child Labour agreed that immediate and effective steps must be taken to ensure the complete elimination of child labour from the country.

title: Opposition to move adjournment debate on new Constitution
byline: The Opposition is to move an adjournment debate on a new Constitution today.

title: Anuradhapura doctor rape suspect further remanded
byline: The suspect arrested over the sexual assault and rape of a female doctor at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital has been further remanded till March 24 after being produced before the Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Cancer Patient Aid Scam: Suspects implicated in another fraud case
byline: The two suspects, who were previously arrested for allegedly defrauding cancer patients of over Rs. 2.2 million, have recently been implicated in another similar fraud case in Nikaweratiya, the CID told the Chief Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Two Directors of pyramid scheme company granted bail
byline: Two directors of Smart Win Pvt Ltd, who were remanded in connection with operating an illegal pyramid financial scheme under the guise of a Wallapatta cultivation project, were released on bail today.

title: China's first 1-tonne payload cargo drone completes maiden flight
byline: A large unmanned cargo aircraft, independently developed by Yitong UAV System Co, completed its maiden flight on Saturday at Laixi Dianbu Airport in Qingdao, East China’s Shandong Province, with a payload capacity exceeding one ton, marking another significant breakthrough for China in the field of high-end unmanned aviation equipment, Science and Technology Daily reported on Monday.

title: Health workers to launch 24-hour strike tomorrow
byline: The Association of Health Professionals has announced that it will proceed with its planned 24-hour strike scheduled for tomorrow, March 18th.

title: Court of Appeal orders to execute arrest order on Deshabandu
byline: The Court of Appeal today refused to issue an interim order preventing Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon from being arrested in connection with the Weligama hotel shooting incident.
